Key Match Events: Kyle Hendricks struck out 2 and retired 11 in a row in one stretch
Isaac Paredes and Pete Crow-Armstrong had run-scoring singles in a three-run eighth inning
Pre-Game Insights: Kyle Hendricks can become a free agent after completing a contract worth $70 million over five seasons
Hendricks has spent all 11 of his major league seasons with the Cubs
Hendricks plans to keep pitching and would like to stay with Chicago, but seems resigned to moving on to another team
Post-Match Reflections: Hendricks expressed gratitude to teammates and pitching coach Tommy Hottovy
Cincinnati has lost five in a row
Miscellaneous Highlights: Hendricks' teammates assembled a pyramid of 22 baseballs — one for each of his outs on Saturday — in front of his locker
Rhett Lowder allowed three hits in five innings for the Reds
